intro: Hydrobryum micrantherum var. micrantherum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved marsh moss, is a small, terrestrial moss belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and dense, cushion-like formations, often found in moist, shaded environments. The plant has narrow, linear leaves that are typically curled when dry and spread out when wet. It thrives in acidic, nutrient-poor soils and is often seen in bogs, stream banks, and other wetland habitats. This moss plays a vital role in stabilizing soil and maintaining the ecological balance of its habitat.
